columns.name: security_group_rule_id
columns.description: The ID of the security group rule.

columns.name: group_name
columns.description: The name of the security group to which rule belongs.

columns.name: group_id
columns.description: The ID of the security group to which rule belongs.

columns.name: is_egress
columns.description: Indicates whether the security group rule is an outbound rule.

columns.name: type
columns.description: Type of the rule ( ingress | egress).

columns.name: vpc_id
columns.description: The ID of the VPC for the security group.

columns.name: owner_id
columns.description: The AWS account ID of the owner of the security group to which rule belongs.

columns.name: group_owner_id
columns.description: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the security group.

columns.name: description
columns.description: The security group rule description.

columns.name: ip_protocol
columns.description: The IP protocol name (tcp, udp, icmp, icmpv6) or number [see Protocol Numbers ](http://www.iana.org/assignments/protocol-numbers/protocol-numbers.xhtml). Use -1 to specify all protocols. When authorizing security group rules, specifying -1 or a protocol number other than tcp, udp, icmp, or icmpv6 allows traffic on all ports, regardless of any port range specified. For tcp, udp, and icmp, a port range is specified. For icmpv6, the port range is optional. If port range is omitted, traffic for all types and codes is allowed.

columns.name: from_port
columns.description: The start of port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP/ICMPv6 type number. A value of -1 indicates all ICMP/ICMPv6 types.

columns.name: to_port
columns.description: The end of port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP/ICMPv6 code. A value of -1 indicates all ICMP/ICMPv6 codes.

columns.name: cidr_ip
columns.description: The IPv4 CIDR range. It can be either a CIDR range or a source security group, not both. A single IPv4 address is denoted by /32 prefix length.

columns.name: cidr_ipv4
columns.description: The IPv4 CIDR range.

columns.name: cidr_ipv6
columns.description: The IPv6 CIDR range. It can be either a CIDR range or a source security group, not both. A single IPv6 address is denoted by /128 prefix length.

columns.name: pair_group_id
columns.description: The ID of the security group that references this user ID group pair.

columns.name: referenced_group_id
columns.description: The ID of the referenced security group.

columns.name: pair_group_name
columns.description: The name of the security group that references this user ID group pair.

columns.name: pair_peering_status
columns.description: The status of a VPC peering connection, if applicable.

columns.name: referenced_peering_status
columns.description: The status of a VPC peering connection, if applicable.

columns.name: pair_user_id
columns.description: The ID of an AWS account. For a referenced security group in another VPC, the account ID of the referenced security group is returned in the response. If the referenced security group is deleted, this value is not returned.

columns.name: referenced_user_id
columns.description: The ID of an AWS account. For a referenced security group in another VPC, the account ID of the referenced security group is returned in the response. If the referenced security group is deleted, this value is not returned.

columns.name: pair_vpc_id
columns.description: The ID of the VPC for the referenced security group, if applicable.

columns.name: referenced_vpc_id
columns.description: The ID of the VPC for the referenced security group, if applicable.

columns.name: pair_vpc_peering_connection_id
columns.description: The ID of the VPC peering connection, if applicable.

columns.name: referenced_vpc_peering_connection_id
columns.description: The ID of the VPC peering connection, if applicable.

columns.name: prefix_list_id
columns.description: The ID of the referenced prefix list.
